    1. accept(TcpSegment)

Interface FlowAssembler

All Known Subinterfaces:
ContextualFlowAssembler
All Known Implementing Classes:
HttpFlowAssemblerAdapter, NoOpFlowAssembler, PayloadFlowAssemblerAdapter, ReorderingFlowAssembler, Tn3270FlowAssemblerAdapter
public interface FlowAssembler
Port that aggregates TCP segments for a single flow into ordered byte streams.

Implementations may retain state per flow and are generally not thread-safe without external synchronization.

Since:
RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Optional<ByteStream>
    accept(TcpSegment segment)
    Accepts a TCP segment and, when new contiguous bytes become available, returns the slice as a ByteStream.

  • Method Details

    • accept

      Optional<ByteStream> accept(TcpSegment segment) throws Exception
      Accepts a TCP segment and, when new contiguous bytes become available, returns the slice as a ByteStream.
      Parameters:
      segment - TCP segment belonging to the flow managed by this assembler
      Returns:
      non-empty stream slice when new bytes are ready; otherwise Optional.empty()
      Throws:
      Exception - if segment processing fails
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
